page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ReplaceSmatch as l(pattern as c,replace as c)

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: True indicates that the replacement was done.

argument.name: pattern
argument.description: The text that you want to find in the buffer. You may use the "?" (single character) and "*" (any number of characters) expressions.

argument.name: replace
argument.description: The text to substitute for Find_Text.

page.description: Look for an smatch pattern, and replace it if found.
page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.ReplaceSmatchI() function replaces the first instance of Find_Text (case insensitive) with Replace_Text, if it can be found between the offset and the end of the buffer.The offset is positioned immediately after Replace_Text.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This is wonderful text written by a great writer %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.replacesmatchi("w*ful", "windful") = .T. ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This is windful" ? scanner.GetRemainder() =prose written by a technical writer of note.
